intro: Pilosella panticosae, commonly known as the Panticosta bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pilosella panticosae is notable for its delicate appearance and is often found in high-altitude meadows.
